name: Juniper Bonsai
climate: Prefers temperate climates where it is warm but not excessively hot.
Juniper Bonsai can handle colder conditions but should be protected from frost.
Avoid extremely humid climates as it can affect the plant's growth.
Ideal climate includes some seasonal variation to mimic its natural habitat.
sunlight: Requires plenty of sunlight and should be placed in a bright location.
Direct sunlight for a few hours daily is beneficial for its health.
Can be kept outside for most of the year except in extreme conditions.
Indoor placement should be near a window with ample natural light.
watering: Juniper Bonsai requires regular watering, but the soil should not remain waterlogged.
Allow the soil to dry slightly between watering to prevent root rot.
In summer, more frequent watering may be necessary due to higher temperatures.
Ensure that the pot has sufficient drainage to maintain optimal moisture levels.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil that retains some moisture but drains excess water.
A bonsai soil mix with akadama, pumice, and lava rock works well.
Avoid compacted soil that can hinder drainage and root health.
Amend soil with organic matter to improve its structure and nutrient content.
toxic: Juniper Bonsai may possess slight toxicity to pets if ingested, particularly in berries.
extra_care_tip: Pruning should be conducted regularly to maintain its shape and health.
In winter, consider providing additional protection to prevent frost damage.
Repotting is necessary every couple of years to refresh soil and root space.
A balanced liquid fertilizer can be applied monthly during the growing season.
